chapter.text: By the star when it sets
Your companion neither went astray nor was he misled
nor does he speak out of (his own) desire
It is nothing but a communication, communicated
One (Jibraeel) severe in strength, made it known to him
(he) possesses vigor so he sought equilibrium
when he was on the high horizon
Then he came near and he came down
and was at a distance of two bows, length or closer
then he communicated to His servant that which he communicated
The heart did not lie (in communicating) what it saw
What ! do you dispute with him as to what he saw
And he indeed saw him (Jibraeel) in another descent
near the farthest lote tree
near which is the garden for staying
when that covered the lote tree which covered
The sight neither deviated nor exceeded the limits
He indeed saw (some) of the greater signs of his Lord
Did you (ever) see Al Lat and Al Uzza
and Manat the third (and) the last (idol)
What! for you the males and for Him the females
Then that is an unfair division

They are nothing but names which you have named, you and your fathers, for which God has not sent down any authority. They follow nothing but conjecture and that which their souls desire, though the guidance has come to them from their Lord
Or, shall man have what (all) he desires
But God’s is the hereafter (future) and the former (past)
And how many an angel is there in the skies, whose recommendation will be of no use in anything, except after God gives permission to whom He wills and pleases
Those who do not believe in the hereafter certainly name the angels with female names
and they do not have any knowledge about it, they follow nothing but conjecture, and conjecture is certainly of no use in anything compared to the truth
So keep away from him who turns away from Our remembrance and desires nothing but the life of this world
That is the (ultimate) reach of their knowledge. Your Lord certainly knows best, him who goes astray from His way, and He knows best, him who receives guidance
And whatever is in the skies and whatever is in the earth is God’s that He may reward those who do evil for that which they did and (that) He may reward those who do good with (something) better

Those who avoid great sins and indecencies except small faults, (then) your Lord is certainly Ample in protectively forgiving (them). He knew you best when He produced you from the earth and when you were hidden in the wombs of your mothers, therefore do not attribute purity to yourselves. He knows best him who guards (against evil)
Did you not see him who turns his back
and gives a little and withholds
Has he with him the knowledge of the unseen so that he sees
Or was he not informed of that which was in the books of Moses
and Abraham, who fulfilled (his responsibility by informing)
that no bearer of burden will bear the burden of another
and that there is nothing for man except that which he strives for
and that his striving will be seen
then he will be rewarded for it with a full reward
and that towards your Lord is the (ultimate) goal
and that it is He Who makes (one) laugh and makes (one) weep
and that it is He Who gives death and gives life
and that He created the pairs, the male and the female
from the sperm when it was poured
and that on Him is (the responsibility of) the later production (creation after death)
and that it is He Who gives riches and satisfaction
and that He is the Lord of the (star) Sirius
and that He destroyed the ancient Aad
and Thamud, He did not allow to remain
and the people of Noah earlier, because they were more unjust and more rebellious
and the overthrown cities, He overthrew
so there covered them that which covered
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you dispute about
This is a warner like the ancient warners
The approaching one draws near
none besides God can expose it
Do you then wonder at this statement
and you laugh and do not weep
while you are involved in vanities (being heedless of your duty)
Therefore bow down before God and serve (Him)
